name: She%27s_Gone_Away
text:
She's Gone Away
"She's Gone Away" was a song by the Nine Inch Nails.
History
In late 2016, the Nine Inch Nails played "She's Gone Away" at the Roadhouse in Twin Peaks, Washington.
Behind the scenes
"She's Gone Away" is a song written for Twin Peaks by Nine Inch Nail and featured on their 2016 extended play Not the Actual Events. It was the second song submitted, as David Lynch felt their first was not "ugly" or "aggressive" enough. The song was featured in "Part 8" of Twin Peaks (2017) and appeared as track 9 on Twin Peaks (Music From The Limited Event Series).
Lyrics
You dig in places till your fingers bleedSpread the infection, where you spill your seedI can't remember what she came here forI can't remember much of anything anymoreShe's gone, she's gone, she's gone away (x2)Away (x2)A little mouth opened up insideYeah, I was watching on the day she diedWe keep licking while the skin turns blackCut along the length, but you can't get the feeling backShe's gone, she's gone, she's gone away (x4)Away (x4)(Are you still here?)
Credits
Written by Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross
Performed by Nine Inch Nails
Produced by Trent Reznor and Atticus Ross
